## Autovoter Contract v1.0



### How to use it?
1. Create a smart contract.
2. Send some SEM to contract address.
3. Set a delegate address by contract call:
`0xca5eb5e1000000000000000000000000 + delegate Address without 0x`
4. Call sendVote function by: 
	`0xc8f5714e + amount in hex (32 bytes)`
	For example this is sendVote(0.5 SEM)
	`0xc8f5714e00000000000000000000000000000000000000000000000006f05b59d3b20000`
	`6f05b59d3b20000` = 500000000000000000
5. Ideally, in the final step you need to wait until validator will call your contract without any data. (empty call with gas). It's needed to call autoVote() function. But if it's not happens - you can call autoVote using any other legit address you think, after you set it. It might external service that will call your contract everyday, just like https://www.ethereum-alarm-clock.com/

------------
To withdraw coins, you need to make another call:
`0x1263442e000000000000000000000000 + address for withdraw (without 0x) + amount in hex (32 bytes)`

Also you can set a legit address, that can call autoVote function.
`0x02868370000000000000000000000000 + legit Address without 0x`


------------

It might be cool if Semux devs can implement optional author-pays feature in Semux EVM, so contracts can use self balance to make a call. ETH guys has discussion about it - https://blog.ethereum.org/2015/12/24/understanding-serenity-part-i-abstraction/





                
Contract bytecode
``
